column4: I'm gonna run xp/ubuntu dual boot, and I'm wondering if I should use ext3 or fat32 for my shared partition. I'm aware that ext3 is better, but I want it to work as good as possible with both os'es. With the ext3 fs-driver for windows I think I've had trouble with nordic letters in filenames earlier. Any advice guys?
Go fat32. Worst that will happen is that you'll need to defrag it every now and then.
well, you kinda answered your own question while asking it. ;-)
hehe. need to start trusting my own advice :-)
